title: Filers
content: Been using Thunderbird several years for IMAP accounts. In past year began using Thunderbird for my company email that migrated to Exchange. I have TB 102.13.1 setup to retrieve my company email thru Owl for Exchange plugin. Been using it for while now and all goes good with the exception of filters and tags. I have several filters setup on the inbox to check on incoming messages and every 10 minutes. If an email comes in from a certain sender the filter will tag it a certain color. I have a total of 3 filters that look for particular senders to tag different colors. When I first setup it seemed to work as intended. Recently it has stopped to automatically tagging the emails. I can manually tag the email but that kinda defeats the purpose of having the filters. Is there anything I should look for to trace the problem. As I said it worked initially. TIA
creator: tpoole

title: cannot send email but can receive them
content: Hello, I can receive emails but I can't send them.. I use spectrum and all my settings are according to their designations.. See below for the snap shot of the smtp settings... I checked my password several times and that's correct too... I need help please! Jerry

title: Inbox emails have disappeared.
content:
I had a bunch of emails in my gmail inbox that I was getting back to as I had time. Put the machine down for lunch, and when I came back, all of those emails are now gone, except for 4 new ones. They show in the browser version of gmail, but won't download or display in Thunderbird... so what happened in the last hour that caused this to happen? Running version 102.13.0 (64-bit). Starting to worry about Thunderbird because this isn't the first time something like this has happened. Last time all my subfolders disappeared as well. Honestly can't remember what it took to get them back, I think it might have been deleting the account and re-installing it. Seems like a somewhat drastic cure, does it not? What can I try before I have to go that route?

And upon further investigation, I'm missing *some* folders again... and they do show up in gmail online.
creator: kharrisma

title: Corrupted inbox-file - unable to repair
content:
Hi,

The data for the Thunderbird files are on an external hard drive. There seems to have been a power fluctuation, which is why the hard disk went out during operation; this has now caused a corruption in the inbox file.

Error messages kept coming that the inbox could not be compressed because of a write error.

I then tried to back up all the mails in an extra folder, but unfortunately this only succeeded until a certain point in time (end of 2019). I then used Thunderbird's own function to repair the folder, with the result that I could now only see one mail in the inbox - all mails after the corruption were no longer displayed.

Fortunately, I still had a backup and was now able to restore all mails until the end of 2021. At the moment 2022 are still missing until today

I have backed up the corrupted file and would now like to try to restore the mails from 2022 to today. When I try to copy this file or open it in a conversion programme, the process seems to stop at about 40% - I suspect that this is where the corruption is.

What options do I have now to restore the mails from 2022 to today?

As I see it, the Thunderbird mbox files are nothing more than long text files with the contents of the mails. So I could turn the inbox file into a two-file version that only outputs everything from about 41% onwards, in order to be able to restore the remaining mails. How can I do that?
creator: toxiclizard

title: Turn off message threading GLOBALLY for all account/folders/everything.
content:
Hey Guys,

As the title says, I need to turn message threading off globally, for all accounts, everything. Hate is a strong work but I really hate this. :)

Can we just get a check box for this in the setting menu to will apply this globally *for good*?

I have tried the plethora of solutions floating around these forums, and basically they don't work. Even the official method of going FOLDER BY FOLDER and turning threading off, doesn't actually turn it off.

Many users do not want manipulation of our inbox in any way. We don't want grouping or categories or anything, we just want the inbox, in chronological order.
creator: paul.seeds

C'è qualche operazione che posso fare?

Cordiali saluti, Tommaso

title: Convertir el mensaje a... ya no está disponible en Thunderbird 115.0.1 Supernova
content:
Buenos días,

La opción de "Convertir el mensaje a..." para poder convertir un mensaje de correo a una tarea o evento en Thunderbird, ha desaparecido con la actualización a la versión 115.0.1 Supernova.

Esta opción era muy apreciada, ya que podías convertir un simple correo en un evento o tarea programada para un día y hora de manera que no tenías que copiar y pegar los datos del e-mail en la tarea o evento, para tenerlo en el Calendario.

Esta opción de "Convertir el mensaje a..." ¿se puede activar de nuevo? ¿está ahora en otro punto del menú? ¿por qué no sale en el menú contextual cuando seleccionas un mensaje?

Gracias por vuestros comentarios.

Saludos, Enric Barcelona
creator: kin.bcn

title: Abrir mensajes en conversación no funciona en Thunderbird 115.0.1 Supernova
content: Buenos días, Desde la actualizción de Thunderbird a su versión 115.0.1 Supernova, la opción de "Abrir mensajes en conversación" para mostrar todos los mensajes con el mismo asunto, NO funciona, abre una ventana en blanco, sin resultados. Eliminé manualmente los archivos global-messages-db.sqlite y global-messages-db.sqlite.journal, para que generara de nuevo esas bases de datos, pero a pesar de todo, los mensajes en conversación no se muestran. ¿Alguien sabe cómo solucionarlo? El Thunderbird lo tengo instalado sobre un Windows 10 Pro de 64 bits, actualizado a su versión 22H2. Muchas gracias por la ayuda. Saludos, Enric Barcelona.

creator: b.borman

title: Cannot disable keyboard shortcuts on MacOS
content:
Hi, I'm trying to use the tbkeys addon to make navigating Thunderbird with my keyboard easier, however in the process of setting stuff up I stumbled across a native Thunderbird issue.

If I go to the MacOS System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Keyboard shortcuts, and I override default shortcuts i.e. Message->Mark->As Junk from the default J to control+command+shift+option+F12 (basically just trying to disable it by using a key combination I'll never hit), hitting J in Thunderbird still marks the current message as junk. This still happens after a Thunderbird restart with all addons disabled. This basically prevents me from customizing the keybinds with the tbkeys addon and makes Thunderbird a lot less useful to me.

If there's a way to truly disable/change keybinds within Thunderbird itself, I'd happily go in that direction, but I couldn't find any documentation on it. tbkeys seemingly "prevent defaults" the keybinds you specify, however that seems to fall apart if you hold the key down. Regardless, I think that disabling or changing the keybinds without needing an addon should be a native Thunderbird feature.

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you!
creator: wilhueb
